definition: both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
to defeat/to damage/to lose (to an opponent)/to fail/to wither
entirely/without exception/(literary) to be together/to be alike
to injure/injury/wound

sentences.english: Both of them were weakened by the war.; Neither side gained in the war.
sentences.chinese: 在那场战争中他们两败俱伤。

sentences.english: The once, seem to be miserable, eventually internecine.
sentences.chinese: 那个曾经，似乎惨不忍睹，最终两败俱伤。

sentences.english: The beginning of aestheticism, internecine ending.
sentences.chinese: 唯美的开始，两败俱伤的结局。

sentences.english: Get the south and north side gangs to kill each other so someone else can take over.
sentences.chinese: 让南北两边的人杀个两败俱伤然后某个人坐收渔利。

sentences.english: A war with America would be "lose-lose", but China should not be afraid of it.
sentences.chinese: 中美之战必然会两败俱伤，但是中国不要畏惧。

definition: lit. you die, I live (idiom); irreconcilable adversaries/two parties cannot coexist
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
two tigers fighting (idiom); fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries
to die in such a way that sb (or sth) else also perishes/to take sb down with oneself/to end in mutual destruction
if two tigers fight, one will get injured (idiom)/if you start a war, someone is bound to get hurt
pinyin: liang3 hu3 xiang1 zheng1 , bi4 you3 yi1 shang1

definition: benefit from others' dispute (idiom)
to fight to one's last gasp
to massacre one another (idiom); internecine strife
two tigers fight (idiom); fig. a dispute between two powerful adversaries/a battle of the giants
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to vie against one another/to fight each other/mutual aggression
to meet force with force/painstaking
to give up
evenly matched (idiom)
